UCLA Website Evaluation

It needs some work.

Presentation by:


Sam Flick, David Desloge, Mhari Shaw, Silas Walker

Designed by:


Sam Flick

Introduction

We are making this presentation to critique and give some insights into the design of UCLA's website. We will be going over these main points.

  • There is a lack of uniform design
  • The logo and brand aesthetic is not audience focused.
  • The navigation of the site is difficult to understand.
  • The visuals are very weak and non-professional.

Image via ucla.edu

The Logo

We think that the logo, while it is effective in communicating a name, is strange in its presentation. The sans-serif font looks strange from a distance and the italics make it seem like something is off.

  • The italics are strange and off-putting
  • The color palette provides a weird contrast between desaturated blues and saturated golden yellow.
  • The visuals are very corporate and are focues away from a student audience and towards an investor audience.

Website Analysis

The website is very corporate and hard to navigate. The color palette as mentioned before clashes with the photography and is very disorientating.

  • The blue and the yellow clashed with the eyes.
  • There is too many things on the homescreen.
  • When I go onto the site, I don't know where to go first.

Conclusion

The UCLA brand is very corporate oriented and not user-friendly. The whole aesthetic is very off putting and disorients me when I land on their website. There are so many pages that are on the website that I get stuck when I land on the site and with so many options to choose from that I get paralysis when I see it.

I think that the website needs to have a refined non-italicized logo, updated colors and imagery, and a simpler website design that points me in the direction where I need to go.

Sam Flick, David Desloge, Mhari Shaw, Silas Walker

Website made by Sam Flick.

All images are from the ucla official website and or from Creative Commons websites.
